titleStmt.title: Whereas Rory Mac Randal Mac Donnel late of the barony of Dungannon in the county of Tyrone, Owen Doo Mac Donnel of the same, Toole Ballagh Mac Donnel late of Croskevenagh in the barony and county aforesaid, [and 16 others] and their complices have in the counties of Monoghan, Antrim, Downe, Tyrone and Londonderry, and other places appeared in arms against His Majesties authority, and several of them have committed murders, burglaries, robberies and stealths ... by the Lord Deputy and Council, Ossory.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Deputy.

titleStmt.title: Whereas Rory Mac Randal Mac Donnel late of the barony of Dungannon in the county of Tyrone, Owen Doo Mac Donnel of the same, Toole Ballagh Mac Donnel late of Croskevenagh in the barony and county aforesaid, [and 16 others] and their complices have in the counties of Monoghan, Antrim, Downe, Tyrone and Londonderry, and other places appeared in arms against His Majesties authority, and several of them have committed murders, burglaries, robberies and stealths ... by the Lord Deputy and Council, Ossory.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Deputy.
Ossory, Thomas Butler, Earl of, 1634-1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Crook ... and are to be sold by Samuel Dancer ...,

notesStmt.note: Statement of responsibility transposed from head of title.
"Given at the Council chamber in Dublin the third day of June 1668"--leaf [2]
Reproduction of original in the Society of Antiquaries Library, London.
